title: Food Memories from Japan and Discovering New Cuisines in Texas
summary: Yayoi Takeuchi reflects on her childhood in Yokosuka, Japan, the centrality of rice, miso, tofu, and vegetables in her diet, and the regional food differences she experienced. After immigrating to the U.S., she explored Mexican, Thai, Vietnamese, and Indian cuisines, eventually developing new tastes while maintaining Japanese food traditions.

title: Gentrification, Grocery Work, and Foodways in Dallas
summary: Leah Bennett discusses growing up in Dallas, witnessing rapid gentrification, and working at Central Market under strict and stressful conditions. She describes her family's soul food traditions, her experiences with regional cuisines during travel, and her sensitivity to overstimulating grocery environments.

title: Mexican American Food Traditions and Navigating Diets
summary: Noah Huerta shares memories of being raised on Mexican American staples like sopita, rice, beans, and tamales, much of it prepared by his grandmother. He discusses attempts at vegan and vegetarian diets, emotional relationships with food, and moments where cultural foods helped him feel connected to family.

title: Chicano Food Memories and Community Roots
summary: Jeff Castañeda Jr. reflects on growing up in a Chicano household where food expressed family identity, community ties, and shared traditions. He highlights dishes passed down through generations and how they shaped his understanding of culture and belonging.

title: Southern Food Memories and Shifting Food Environments
summary: Anna Howington discusses growing up around Southern staples, family gatherings centered on food, and the ways relocation influenced her tastes and eating habits. She describes food as a grounding presence across different stages of her life.

title: Salvadoran Traditions and Food Across Borders
summary: Juliana Alvarado shares memories of growing up with Salvadoran dishes and the ways migration shaped her food experiences. She reflects on balancing traditional foods with new ingredients and cultural influences in North Texas.
